result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sevion R Black

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sevion R Black in court.  Attorney Imran Kurter not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kurter is unable to appear, requested a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Sevion R Black in court.  Attorney Imran Kurter in court for Sevion R Black.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel recently appointed and needs discovery and offer from the State.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sevion R Black in court.    Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br.13 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/12/2022@1pm
